receiver) {<span class="line"><!---->    mojo::PendingReceiver&lt;blink::mojom::NotificationService&gt; receiver) {<!----></span><br>  DCHECK_CURRENTLY_ON(BrowserThread::UI);<span class="line"><!---->         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6d78af3b303c82ad960f4a45ad48a0bcdf6aa2e6<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6d78af3b303c82ad960f4a45ad48a0bcdf6aa2e6"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6d78af3b303c82ad960f4a45ad48a0bcdf6aa2e6<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>6d78af3b303c82ad960f4a45ad48a0bcdf6aa2e6<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/6d78af3b303c82ad960f4a45ad48a0bcdf6aa2e6"><!---->6d78af3b303c82ad960f4a45ad48a0bcdf6aa2e6<!----></a><br>Author: Mingyu Lei <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Mingyu Lei &lt;<!----></span>leimy@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/leimy@chromium.org"><!---->leimy@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Nov 03 14:50:08 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Nov 03 14:50:08 2022<!----></span><br><br>Use RFH ID instead of pointer during binding to avoid UAF<span class="line"><!---->Use RFH ID instead of pointer during binding to avoid UAF<!----></span><br><br>In <span class="line"><!---->In <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/3876770<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/3876770"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/3876770<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> when creating binder for<span class="line"><!----> when creating binder for<!----></span><br>`blink::mojom::NotificationService`, the `RenderFrameHost*` is captured<span class="line"><!---->`blink::mojom::NotificationService`, the `RenderFrameHost*` is captured<!----></span><br>in the `RepeatingCallback` and will be referenced later when the real<span class="line"><!---->in the `RepeatingCallback` and will be referenced later when the real<!----></span><br>mojo call comes in. This introduces a risk of use-after-free if there<span class="line"><!---->mojo call comes in. This introduces a risk of use-after-free if there<!----></span><br>are some race condition between the destruction of the `RenderFrameHost`<span class="line"><!---->are some race condition between the destruction of the `RenderFrameHost`<!----></span><br>and the `DedicatedWorkerHost`.<span class="line"><!---->and the `DedicatedWorkerHost`.<!----></span><br><br>In this CL, we pass the ID during the binding, and retrieve the<span class="line"><!---->In this CL, we pass the ID during the binding, and retrieve the<!----></span><br>`RenderFrameHost` during the real creation to ensure that its state<span class="line"><!---->`RenderFrameHost` during the real creation to ensure that its state<!----></span><br>is valid before getting the `WeakDocumentPtr`. This should prevent the<span class="line"><!---->is valid before getting the `WeakDocumentPtr`. This should prevent the<!----></span><br>use-after-free crash.<span class="line"><!---->use-after-free crash.<!----></span><br><br>See the bug link for more information of the crash.<span class="line"><!---->See the bug link for more information of the crash.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1379579<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1379579" title="Security: heap-use-after-free browser\renderer_host\render_process_host_impl.cc:2068 in content::RenderProcessHostImpl::CreateNotificationService"><!---->Bug: 1379579<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I2c4d71bc5a3e228d4d061f57402c50e3e517bbf6<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I2c4d71bc5a3e228d4d061f57402c50e3e517bbf6<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: class="line"><!---->Reviewed-by: Alexander Timin &lt;<!----></span>altimin@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/altimin@chromium.org"><!---->altimin@chromium.org<!----></a>><span         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The looping to achieve execution was not in the renderer; this issue is not demonstrated as easy to achieve reliable triggering and beating the race. The POC provided and used to achieve this result was also quite large and not at all minimized. Due to these conditions, we feel that the reward is appropriate for this report.<span class="line"><!---->The looping to achieve execution was not in the renderer; this issue is not demonstrated as easy to achieve reliable triggering and beating the race.       <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);

          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }

          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);

        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }

          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;

          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }

  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;

    text-decoration: underline;
  }

    /* Links that look like buttons. */

    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;

    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }

    text-decoration: underline;
  }

    /* Links that look like buttons. */

    align-items: center;

  }

    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }

  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.

      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);

    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }

    background: none;
  }

    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;

    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */

    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>


      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

          <slot></slot>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>


          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        #RCA<span class="line"><!---->#RCA<!----></span><br><br>In this CL <span class="line"><!---->In this CL <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3876770<a the rfh raw pointer to BindNotificationService	[1]<span class="line"><!---->PopulateBinderMapWithContext passes the rfh raw pointer to BindNotificationService	[1]<!----></span><br>BindNotificationService pass it to BindRepeating(CreateNotificationService)	[2]<span class="line"><!---->BindNotificationService pass it to BindRepeating(CreateNotificationService)	[2]<!----></span><br>finally uses it in CreateNotificationService without observe the rfh life cycle	[3]<span class="line"><!---->finally uses it in CreateNotificationService without observe the rfh life cycle	[3]<!----></span><br>resulting in UAF<span class="line"><!---->resulting in UAF<!----></span><br><br>```<span         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6d78af3b303c82ad960f4a45ad48a0bcdf6aa2e6<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6d78af3b303c82ad960f4a45ad48a0bcdf6aa2e6"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6d78af3b303c82ad960f4a45ad48a0bcdf6aa2e6<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>6d78af3b303c82ad960f4a45ad48a0bcdf6aa2e6<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/6d78af3b303c82ad960f4a45ad48a0bcdf6aa2e6"><!---->6d78af3b303c82ad960f4a45ad48a0bcdf6aa2e6<!----></a><br>Author: Mingyu Lei <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Mingyu Lei &lt;<!----></span>leimy@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/leimy@chromium.org"><!---->leimy@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Nov 03 14:50:08 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Nov 03 14:50:08 2022<!----></span><br><br>Use RFH ID instead of pointer during binding to avoid UAF<span class="line"><!---->Use RFH ID instead of pointer during binding to avoid UAF<!----></span><br><br>In <span class="line"><!---->In <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/3876770<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/3876770"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/3876770<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> when creating binder for<span class="line"><!----> when creating binder for<!----></span><br>`blink::mojom::NotificationService`, the `RenderFrameHost*` is captured<span class="line"><!---->`blink::mojom::NotificationService`, the `RenderFrameHost*` is captured<!----></span><br>in the `RepeatingCallback` and will be referenced later when the real<span class="line"><!---->in the `RepeatingCallback` and will be referenced later when the real<!----></span><br>mojo call comes in. This introduces a risk of use-after-free if there<span class="line"><!---->mojo call comes in. This introduces a risk of use-after-free if there<!----></span><br>are some race condition between the destruction of the `RenderFrameHost`<span class="line"><!---->are some race condition between the destruction of the `RenderFrameHost`<!----></span><br>and the `DedicatedWorkerHost`.<span class="line"><!---->and the `DedicatedWorkerHost`.<!----></span><br><br>In this CL, we pass the ID during the binding, and retrieve the<span class="line"><!---->In this CL, we pass the ID during the binding, and retrieve the<!----></span><br>`RenderFrameHost` during the real creation to ensure that its state<span class="line"><!---->`RenderFrameHost` during the real creation to ensure that its state<!----></span><br>is valid before getting the `WeakDocumentPtr`. This should prevent the<span class="line"><!---->is valid before getting the `WeakDocumentPtr`. This should prevent the<!----></span><br>use-after-free crash.<span class="line"><!---->use-after-free crash.<!----></span><br><br>See the bug link for more information of the crash.<span class="line"><!---->See the bug link for more information of the crash.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1379579<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1379579" title="Security: heap-use-after-free browser\renderer_host\render_process_host_impl.cc:2068 in content::RenderProcessHostImpl::CreateNotificationService"><!---->Bug: 1379579<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I2c4d71bc5a3e228d4d061f57402c50e3e517bbf6<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I2c4d71bc5a3e228d4d061f57402c50e3e517bbf6<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on:         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The looping to achieve execution was not in the renderer; this issue is not demonstrated as easy to achieve reliable triggering and beating the race. The POC provided and used to achieve this result was also quite large and not at all minimized. Due to these conditions, we feel that the reward is appropriate for this report.<span class="line"><!---->The looping to achieve execution was not in the renderer; this issue is not demonstrated as easy to achieve reliable triggering and beating the race.       <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);

          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }

          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;

          z-index: 100;
        }

          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          <chops-button>

        #RCA<span class="line"><!---->#RCA<!----></span><br><br>In this CL <span class="line"><!---->In this CL <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3876770<a the rfh raw pointer to BindNotificationService	[1]<span class="line"><!---->PopulateBinderMapWithContext passes the rfh raw pointer to BindNotificationService	[1]<!----></span><br>BindNotificationService pass it to BindRepeating(CreateNotificationService)	[2]<span class="line"><!---->BindNotificationService pass it to CreateNotificationService without observe the rfh life cycle	[3]<!----></span><br>resulting in UAF<span class="line"><!---->resulting in UAF<!----></span><br><br>```<span <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>6d78af3b303c82ad960f4a45ad48a0bcdf6aa2e6<a class="undefined" target="_blank" &lt;<!----></span>leimy@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/leimy@chromium.org"><!---->leimy@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Nov 03 14:50:08 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Nov 03 14:50:08 2022<!----></span><br><br>Use RFH ID instead of pointer during binding to avoid UAF<span class="line"><!---->Use RFH ID instead of pointer during binding to avoid UAF<!----></span><br><br>In <span class="line"><!---->In <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/3876770<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/3876770"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/3876770<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> when creating binder for<span class="line"><!----> when creating binder for<!----></span><br>`blink::mojom::NotificationService`, the `RenderFrameHost*` is captured<span class="line"><!---->`blink::mojom::NotificationService`, the `RenderFrameHost*` is captured<!----></span><br>in the `RepeatingCallback` and will be referenced later when the real<span class="line"><!---->in the `RepeatingCallback` and will be referenced later when the real<!----></span><br>mojo call comes in. This introduces a risk of use-after-free if there<span class="line"><!---->mojo call comes in. This introduces a risk of use-after-free if there<!----></span><br>are some race condition between the destruction of the `RenderFrameHost`<span class="line"><!---->are some race condition between the destruction of the `RenderFrameHost`<!----></span><br>and the `DedicatedWorkerHost`.<span class="line"><!---->and the `DedicatedWorkerHost`.<!----></span><br><br>In this CL, we pass the ID during the binding, and retrieve the<span class="line"><!---->In this CL, we pass the ID during the binding, and retrieve the<!----></span><br>`RenderFrameHost` during the real creation to ensure that its state<span class="line"><!---->`RenderFrameHost` during the real creation to ensure that its state<!----></span><br>is valid before getting the `WeakDocumentPtr`. This should prevent the<span class="line"><!---->is valid before getting the `WeakDocumentPtr`. This should prevent the<!----></span><br>use-after-free crash.<span class="line"><!---->use-after-free crash.<!----></span><br><br>See the bug link for more information of the crash.<span class="line"><!---->See the bug link for more information of the crash.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1379579<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1379579"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1379579#c29">Comment 29<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        The looping to achieve execution was not in the renderer; this issue is not demonstrated as easy to achieve reliable triggering and beating the race. The POC provided and used to achieve this result was also quite large and not at all minimized. Due to these conditions, we feel that the reward is appropriate for this report.<span class="line"><!---->The looping to achieve execution was not in the renderer; this issue is not demonstrated as easy to achieve reliable triggering and beating the race. The POC provided and used to achieve this result was also quite large and not at all minimized. Due to these conditions, we feel that the reward is appropriate for this report.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          <div class="input-grid">

         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

            Discard

          <chops-button class="emphasized">
            Save changes
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </form>
    
    </chops-dialog>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

&lt;<!----></span>leimy@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/leimy@chromium.org"><!---->leimy@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Nov 03 14:50:08 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Nov 03 14:50:08 2022<!----></span><br><br>Use RFH ID instead of pointer during binding to avoid UAF<span class="line"><!---->Use RFH ID instead of pointer during binding to avoid UAF<!----></span><br><br>In <span class="line"><!---->In <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/3876770<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/3876770"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/3876770<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> when creating binder for<span class="line"><!----> when creating binder for<!----></span><br>`blink::mojom::NotificationService`, the `RenderFrameHost*` is captured<span class="line"><!---->`blink::mojom::NotificationService`, the `RenderFrameHost*` is captured<!----></span><br>in the `RepeatingCallback` and will be referenced later when the real<span class="line"><!---->in the `RepeatingCallback` and will be referenced later when the real<!----></span><br>mojo call comes in. This introduces a risk of use-after-free if there<span class="line"><!---->mojo call comes in. This introduces a risk of use-after-free if there<!----></span><br>are some race condition between the destruction of the `RenderFrameHost`<span class="line"><!---->are some race condition between the destruction of the `RenderFrameHost`<!----></span><br>and the `DedicatedWorkerHost`.<span class="line"><!---->and the `DedicatedWorkerHost`.<!----></span><br><br>In this CL, we pass the ID during the binding, and retrieve the<span class="line"><!---->In this CL, we pass the ID during the binding, and retrieve the<!----></span><br>`RenderFrameHost` during the real creation to ensure that its state<span class="line"><!---->`RenderFrameHost` during the real creation to ensure that its state<!----></span><br>is valid before getting the `WeakDocumentPtr`. This should prevent the<span class="line"><!---->is valid before getting the `WeakDocumentPtr`. This should prevent the<!----></span><br>use-after-free crash.<span class="line"><!---->use-after-free crash.<!----></span><br><br>See the bug link for more information of the crash.<span class="line"><!---->See the bug link for more information of the crash.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1379579<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1379579"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 29<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1379579#c29">Comment 29<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      amyressler@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/3767437993" title="amyressler@chromium.org"><!---->amyressler@chromium.org<!----></a>

          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1379579#c29">Comment 29<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Nov 17, 2022, 6:13 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1379579#c29">Comment 29<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Nov 17, 2022, 6:13 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        The looping to achieve execution was not in the renderer; this issue is not demonstrated as easy to achieve reliable triggering and beating the race. The POC provided and used to achieve this result was also quite large and not at all minimized. Due to these conditions, we feel that the reward is appropriate for this report.<span class="line"><!---->The looping to achieve execution was not in the renderer; this issue is not demonstrated as easy to achieve reliable triggering and beating the race. The POC provided and used to achieve this result was also quite large and not at all minimized. Due to these conditions, we feel that the reward is appropriate for this report.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        #RCA<span class="line"><!---->#RCA<!----></span><br><br>In this CL <span class="line"><!---->In this CL <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3876770<a CreateNotificationService without observe the rfh life cycle	[3]<!----></span><br>resulting in UAF<span class="line"><!---->resulting in UAF<!----></span><br><br>```<span <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>6d78af3b303c82ad960f4a45ad48a0bcdf6aa2e6<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/6d78af3b303c82ad960f4a45ad48a0bcdf6aa2e6"><!---->6d78af3b303c82ad960f4a45ad48a0bcdf6aa2e6<!----></a><br>Author: Mingyu Lei <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Mingyu Lei &lt;<!----></span>leimy@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/leimy@chromium.org"><!---->leimy@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Nov 03 14:50:08 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Nov 03 14:50:08 2022<!----></span><br><br>Use RFH ID instead of pointer during binding to avoid UAF<span class="line"><!---->Use RFH ID instead of pointer during binding to avoid UAF<!----></span><br><br>In <span class="line"><!---->In <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/3876770<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/3876770"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/3876770<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> when creating binder for<span class="line"><!----> when creating binder for<!----></span><br>`blink::mojom::NotificationService`, the `RenderFrameHost*` is captured<span class="line"><!---->`blink::mojom::NotificationService`, the `RenderFrameHost*` is captured<!----></span><br>in the `RepeatingCallback` and will be referenced later when the real<span class="line"><!---->in the `RepeatingCallback` and will be referenced later when the real<!----></span><br>mojo call comes in. This introduces a risk of use-after-free if there<span class="line"><!---->mojo call comes in. This introduces a risk of use-after-free if there<!----></span><br>are some race condition between the destruction of the `RenderFrameHost`<span class="line"><!---->are some race condition between the destruction of the `RenderFrameHost`<!----></span><br>and the `DedicatedWorkerHost`.<span class="line"><!---->and the `DedicatedWorkerHost`.<!----></span><br><br>In this CL, we pass the ID during the binding, and retrieve the<span class="line"><!---->In this CL, we pass the ID during the binding, and retrieve the<!----></span><br>`RenderFrameHost` during the real creation to ensure that its state<span class="line"><!---->`RenderFrameHost` during the real creation to ensure that its state<!----></span><br>is valid before getting the `WeakDocumentPtr`. This should prevent the<span class="line"><!---->is valid before getting the `WeakDocumentPtr`. This should prevent the<!----></span><br>use-after-free crash.<span class="line"><!---->use-after-free crash.<!----></span><br><br>See the bug link for more information of the crash.<span class="line"><!---->See the bug link for more information of the crash.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1379579<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1379579"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The looping to achieve execution was not in the renderer; this issue is not demonstrated as easy to achieve reliable triggering and beating the race. The POC provided and used to achieve this result was also quite large and not at all minimized. Due to these conditions, we feel that the reward is appropriate for this report.<span class="line"><!---->The looping to achieve execution was not in the renderer; this issue is not demonstrated as easy to achieve reliable triggering and beating the race. The POC provided and used to achieve this result was also quite large and not at all minimized. Due to these conditions, we feel that the reward is appropriate for this report.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

    <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;

        #RCA<span class="line"><!---->#RCA<!----></span><br><br>In this CL <span class="line"><!---->In this CL <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3876770<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3876770"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3876770<!----></a><br><br>PopulateBinderMapWithContext passes the rfh raw pointer to BindNotificationService	[1]<span class="line"><!---->PopulateBinderMapWithContext passes the rfh raw pointer to BindNotificationService	[1]<!----></span><br>BindNotificationService pass it to BindRepeating(CreateNotificationService)	[2]<span class="line"><!---->BindNotificationService pass it to BindRepeating(CreateNotificationService)	[2]<!----></span><br>finally uses it in CreateNotificationService without observe the rfh life cycle	[3]<span class="line"><!---->finally uses it in CreateNotificationService without observe the rfh life cycle	[3]<!----></span><br>resulting in UAF<span class="line"><!---->resulting in UAF<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void PopulateBinderMapWithContext(<span class="line"><!---->void PopulateBinderMapWithContext(<!----></span><br>    DedicatedWorkerHost* host,<span class="line"><!---->    DedicatedWorkerHost* host,<!----></span><br>    mojo::BinderMapWithContext<const url::Origin&>* map) {<span class="line"><!---->    mojo::BinderMapWithContext&lt;const url::Origin&amp;&gt;* map) {<!----></span><br>  // RenderProcessHost binders taking an origin<span class="line"><!---->  // RenderProcessHost binders taking an origin<!----></span><br>  map->Add<payments::mojom::PaymentManager>(BindWorkerReceiverForOrigin(<span class="line"><!---->  map-&gt;Add&lt;payments::mojom::PaymentManager&gt;(BindWorkerReceiverForOrigin(<!----></span><br>      &RenderProcessHostImpl::CreatePaymentManagerForOrigin, host));<span class="line"><!---->      &amp;RenderProcessHostImpl::CreatePaymentManagerForOrigin, host));<!----></span><br> <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>6d78af3b303c82ad960f4a45ad48a0bcdf6aa2e6<a class="undefined" target="_blank" &lt;<!----></span>leimy@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/leimy@chromium.org"><!---->leimy@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Nov 03 14:50:08 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Nov 03 14:50:08 2022<!----></span><br><br>Use RFH ID instead of pointer during binding to avoid UAF<span class="line"><!---->Use RFH ID instead of pointer during binding to avoid UAF<!----></span><br><br>In <span class="line"><!---->In <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/3876770<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/3876770"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/3876770<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> when creating binder for<span class="line"><!----> when creating binder for<!----></span><br>`blink::mojom::NotificationService`, the `RenderFrameHost*` is captured<span class="line"><!---->`blink::mojom::NotificationService`, the `RenderFrameHost*` is captured<!----></span><br>in the `RepeatingCallback` and will be referenced later when the real<span class="line"><!---->in the `RepeatingCallback` and will be referenced later when the real<!----></span><br>mojo call comes in. This introduces a risk of use-after-free if there<span class="line"><!---->mojo call comes in. This introduces a risk of use-after-free if there<!----></span><br>are some race condition between the destruction of the `RenderFrameHost`<span class="line"><!---->are some race condition between the destruction of the `RenderFrameHost`<!----></span><br>and the `DedicatedWorkerHost`.<span class="line"><!---->and the `DedicatedWorkerHost`.<!----></span><br><br>In this CL, we pass the ID during the binding, and retrieve the<span class="line"><!---->In this CL, we pass the ID during the binding, and retrieve the<!----></span><br>`RenderFrameHost` during the real creation to ensure that its state<span class="line"><!---->`RenderFrameHost` during the real creation to ensure that its state<!----></span><br>is valid before getting the `WeakDocumentPtr`. This should prevent the<span class="line"><!---->is valid before getting the `WeakDocumentPtr`. This should prevent the<!----></span><br>use-after-free crash.<span class="line"><!---->use-after-free crash.<!----></span><br><br>See the bug link for more information of the crash.<span class="line"><!---->See the bug link for more information of the crash.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1379579<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1379579"
