        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The looping to achieve execution was not in the renderer; this issue is not demonstrated as easy to achieve reliable triggering and beating the race. The POC provided and used to achieve this result was also quite large and not at all minimized. Due to these conditions, we feel that the reward is appropriate for this report.<span class="line"><!---->The looping to achieve execution was not in the renderer; this issue is not demonstrated as easy to achieve reliable triggering and beating the race. The POC provided and used to achieve this result was also quite large and not at all minimized. Due to these conditions, we feel that the reward is appropriate for this report.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        #RCA<span class="line"><!---->#RCA<!----></span><br><br>In this CL <span class="line"><!---->In this CL <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3876770<a   this, origin, rfh-&gt;GetLastCommittedURL(), weak_document_ptr,<!----></span><br>          creator_type, std::move(receiver));<span class="line"><!---->          creator_type, std::move(receiver));<!----></span><br>      break;<span class="line"><!---->      break;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

&lt;<!----></span>leimy@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/leimy@chromium.org"><!---->leimy@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Nov 03 14:50:08 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Nov 03 14:50:08 2022<!----></span><br><br>Use RFH ID instead of pointer during binding to avoid UAF<span class="line"><!---->Use RFH ID instead of pointer during binding to avoid UAF<!----></span><br><br>In <span class="line"><!---->In <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/3876770<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/3876770"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/3876770<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> when creating binder for<span class="line"><!----> when creating binder for<!----></span><br>`blink::mojom::NotificationService`, the `RenderFrameHost*` is captured<span class="line"><!---->`blink::mojom::NotificationService`, the `RenderFrameHost*` is captured<!----></span><br>in the `RepeatingCallback` and will be referenced later when the real<span class="line"><!---->in the `RepeatingCallback` and will be referenced later when the real<!----></span><br>mojo call comes in. This introduces a risk of use-after-free if there<span class="line"><!---->mojo call comes in. This introduces a risk of use-after-free if there<!----></span><br>are some race condition between the destruction of the `RenderFrameHost`<span class="line"><!---->are some race condition between the destruction of the `RenderFrameHost`<!----></span><br>and the `DedicatedWorkerHost`.<span class="line"><!---->and the `DedicatedWorkerHost`.<!----></span><br><br>In this CL, we pass the ID during the binding, and retrieve the<span class="line"><!---->In this CL, we pass the ID during the binding, and retrieve the<!----></span><br>`RenderFrameHost` during the real creation to ensure that its state<span class="line"><!---->`RenderFrameHost` during the real creation to ensure that its state<!----></span><br>is valid before getting the `WeakDocumentPtr`. This should prevent the<span class="line"><!---->is valid before getting the `WeakDocumentPtr`. This should prevent the<!----></span><br>use-after-free crash.<span class="line"><!---->use-after-free crash.<!----></span><br><br>See the bug link for more information of the crash.<span class="line"><!---->See the bug link for more information of the crash.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1379579<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1379579"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      </div><br>

        The looping to achieve execution was not in the renderer; this issue is not demonstrated as easy to achieve reliable triggering and beating the race. The POC provided and used to achieve this result was also quite large and not at all minimized. Due to these conditions, we feel that the reward is appropriate for this report.<span class="line"><!---->The looping to achieve execution was not in the renderer; this issue is not demonstrated as easy to achieve reliable triggering and beating the race. The POC provided and used to achieve this result was also quite large and not at all minimized. Due to these conditions, we feel that the reward is appropriate for this report.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        #RCA<span class="line"><!---->#RCA<!----></span><br><br>In this CL <span class="line"><!---->In this CL <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3876770<a the rfh raw pointer to BindNotificationService	[1]<span class="line"><!---->PopulateBinderMapWithContext passes the rfh raw pointer to BindNotificationService	[1]<!----></span><br>BindNotificationService pass it to BindRepeating(CreateNotificationService)	[2]<span class="line"><!---->BindNotificationService pass it to BindRepeating(CreateNotificationService)	[2]<!----></span><br>finally uses it in CreateNotificationService without observe the rfh life cycle	[3]<span class="line"><!---->finally uses it in CreateNotificationService without observe the rfh life cycle	[3]<!----></span><br>resulting in UAF<span class="line"><!---->resulting in UAF<!----></span><br><br>```<span &RenderProcessHostImpl::CreatePermissionService, host));<span class="line"><!---->      &amp;RenderProcessHostImpl::CreatePermissionService, host));<!----></span><br><br>  RenderFrameHost* rfh =<span 03 14:50:08 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Nov 03 14:50:08 2022<!----></span><br><br>Use RFH ID instead of pointer during binding to avoid UAF<span class="line"><!---->Use RFH ID instead of pointer during binding to avoid UAF<!----></span><br><br>In <span class="line"><!---->In <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/3876770<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/3876770"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/3876770<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> when creating binder for<span class="line"><!----> when creating binder for<!----></span><br>`blink::mojom::NotificationService`, the `RenderFrameHost*` is captured<span class="line"><!---->`blink::mojom::NotificationService`, the `RenderFrameHost*` is captured<!----></span><br>in the `RepeatingCallback` and will be referenced later when the real<span class="line"><!---->in the `RepeatingCallback` and will be referenced later when the real<!----></span><br>mojo call comes in. This introduces a risk of use-after-free if there<span class="line"><!---->mojo call comes in. This introduces a risk of use-after-free if there<!----></span><br>are some race condition between the destruction of the `RenderFrameHost`<span class="line"><!---->are some race condition between the destruction of the `RenderFrameHost`<!----></span><br>and the `DedicatedWorkerHost`.<span class="line"><!---->and the `DedicatedWorkerHost`.<!----></span><br><br>In this CL, we pass the ID during the binding, and retrieve the<span class="line"><!---->In this CL, we pass the ID during the binding, and retrieve the<!----></span><br>`RenderFrameHost` during the real creation to ensure that its state<span class="line"><!---->`RenderFrameHost` during the real creation to ensure that its state<!----></span><br>is valid before getting the `WeakDocumentPtr`. This should prevent the<span class="line"><!---->is valid before getting the `WeakDocumentPtr`. This should prevent the<!----></span><br>use-after-free crash.<span class="line"><!---->use-after-free crash.<!----></span><br><br>See the bug link for more information of the crash.<span class="line"><!---->See the bug link for more information of the crash.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1379579<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1379579"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         Thank you for your explanation.<span class="line"><!---->Thank you for your explanation.<!----></span><br><br>It seems that the reward amount of "mildly mitigated by race condition" issue is very random, such as this issue(reward:30k) <span class="line"><!---->It seems that the reward amount of "mildly mitigated by race condition" issue is very random, such as this issue(reward:30k) <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1347707<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1347707"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1347707<!----></a><br>So I think the race condition issue should not be put into the "Moderately mitigated" rule because there isn't any security mitigation here.<span class="line"><!---->So I think the race condition issue should not be put into the "Moderately mitigated" rule because there isn't any security mitigation here.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1379579#c29">Comment 29<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Nov 17, 2022, 6:13 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

        The looping to achieve execution was not in the renderer; this issue is not demonstrated as easy to achieve reliable triggering and beating the race. The POC provided and used to achieve this result was also quite large and not at all minimized. Due to these conditions, we feel that the reward is appropriate for this report.<span class="line"><!---->The looping to achieve execution was not in the renderer; this issue is not demonstrated as easy to achieve reliable triggering and beating the race. The POC provided and used to achieve this result was also quite large and not at all minimized. Due to these conditions, we feel that the reward is appropriate for this report.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

      <br>
      
    
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button class="de-emphasized discard-button">
            Discard
          </chops-button>
          <chops-button class="emphasized">
            Save changes
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </form>
    
    </chops-dialog>
    <mr-update-issue-hotlists-dialog id="update-issue-hotlists"></mr-update-issue-hotlists-dialog>


        
      <div class="snackbar-container" aria-live="polite">
        
      </div>

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
